TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and currently residing in GPE .

In an order of DATE , served on the applicant on DATE , ORG informed the applicant that criminal proceedings were instituted against him for kidnapping and rape and that his ORG had requested the investigating judge to prolong the maximum period for the completion of the investigations .

In an order of DATE , filed with the registry on CARDINAL DATE , ORG requested that the applicant be committed for trial . In an order of DATE , the investigating judge scheduled the preliminary hearing for CARDINAL DATE , on which date the case was adjourned by reason that the committal for trial had not been duly served on the accused . In an order of DATE the investigating judge committed the applicant for trial , commencing on DATE before ORG . The case - file was subsequently forwarded to the investigating judge because the committal for trial had not been duly served on the accused .
In an order of CARDINAL DATE , the investigating judge committed the applicant for trial , commencing on DATE before ORG .
The first hearing did not take place because of a ORG strike . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the case was adjourned at the applicant ’s request .

On DATE the case was postponed by reason that the witnesses summoned to appear were absent . On DATE the case was adjourned until DATE because some witnesses were absent and by reason of the fact that the bench of the court was composed of judges other than those who participated in previous hearings .

A hearing scheduled for DATE did not take place because the lawyers of ORG were on strike . On DATE , the case was adjourned because the witnesses were absent . In a judgement of CARDINAL DATE , filed with the registry on DATE , ORG acquitted the applicant . The decision became final on DATE .

In the meanwhile , on an unspecified date the applicant requested to be enrolled in the list of experts of ORG . However , this request was refused by reason that criminal proceedings were pending against him .
